numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph shows answers of older people and younger people to one question.
3. The question is: Is the world getting better with each generation?
4. I noticed that younger generations are more optimistic than older generations.
6. In the US, more than 50 percent of people who are 15-24 years old believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
7. In the US, less than 50 percent of people who are 40 years old believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
8. I wonder if the political swing of a generation affects the ideas of this generation about the future.
9. I wonder if older populations and younger populations have different beliefs about what is better for the world.
10. This data is important to me.
11. This data is important to my community.
12. Optimism in a community is important for advocating for something.
13. The graph presents a large gap between older generations and younger generations.
14. The large gap indicates major differences between what older generations believe and what younger generations believe.
15. These differences may cause tensions in a community like mine.
16. If a discussion of these differences is not addressed properly then tensions will increase.
17. The name of this graph is: Are the Kids Ruining Everything?
